files.description: Project configuration defining package metadata, dependencies, CLI entry point, formatting, and test tooling.
User-facing documentation describing the mission, installation, CLI usage, workflow outputs, and validation approach (survey + audit study).
Package initializer exposing the public version and high-level APIs for roadmap generation and detection.

Complete argparse-based CLI implementing commands to generate standardized workflows, metadata checklists, survey/audit instruments, and to run lightweight primary-source citation detection on text files.
Dataclasses and JSON-serializable schemas for workflows, metadata checklists, survey instruments, audit study design, and detection results.
Actionable roadmap generator that outputs concrete study designs (surveys + audit studies), measurement instruments, required repositories/data sources, and specialist-agent task assignments.
Templates and builders for survey items, audit-study coding sheets, metadata checklists, and rubrics aligned to primary-source scholarship validation goals.
Lightweight detection features for primary-source scholarship including edition/translation provenance signals, variant pagination heuristics, and repository citation/identifier extraction.
Curated registry of target repositories and identifier patterns (e.g., DOI, JSTOR, HathiTrust, Internet Archive, PsycINFO, PubMed) used by detectors and roadmap outputs.
Pytest suite validating citation/identifier extraction and key detection heuristics with representative text fixtures and edge cases.
Pytest suite ensuring generated roadmap, checklist, and instrument outputs are structurally valid, deterministic, and include required mission elements.
Embedded default configuration containing repository registry entries, checklist fields, and baseline survey/audit instrument item banks.

missionDescription: Design a concrete, testable plan for creating and validating standardized workflows, metadata checklists, and lightweight detection tools for primary-source scholarship in psychology. Produce an actionable roadmap that specifies study designs (surveys + audit studies), measurement instruments, required data sources and repositories, key technical detection features to implement (edition/translation provenance, variant pagination, repository citations), and an assignment of specialist-agent tasks for implementation and evaluation.
missionSuccessCriteria: A detailed study design (including sample frame, recruitment strategy, power/sample-size calculations, and timeline) for surveys of historians/psychologists and audit studies of journal/archival citations.

A prioritized technical specification list of automated checks (exact heuristics and metadata fields) that the lightweight software/plugins must implement, mapped to concrete example inputs and expected outputs.

A task-level roadmap assigning responsibilities to specialist agent types (e.g., code_creation for plugin dev, document_analysis for corpus comparison, research for repository mapping) with milestones and objective metrics for success (e.g., % reduction in citation errors, reproducibility score improvements).

A short validation plan with statistical analysis methods, success thresholds (e.g., effect sizes, confidence intervals), and proposed QA steps for deployment and community endorsement (stakeholder engagement, preprint/benchmarks).
